snippet: Potential donors are being asked not to give blood if within the last month they have visited a country in which the Zika virus is spreading.
abstract: American Red Cross and other blood banks are asking prospective donors who have visited countries affected by Zika virus over previous month not to give blood; virus, for which banks have no approved method of screening, stays in bloodstream of infected person for about one week and has been linked to birth defects.
lead_paragraph: Potential donors are being asked not to give blood if within the last month they have visited a country in which the Zika virus is spreading.

headline.main: Blood Banks Use Caution With Travelers From Zika Zones

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
